III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
MISEP requirements do not apply to this agency.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note
that DHHS contract/policy does not apply to this agency.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Post Placement visits should be occurring once every calendar month.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit any acceptable corrective action plans
not related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment – I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment
dated 8/4/2021 which indicated that they agency staff have been utilizing a
combination of virtual and in-person visits to complete home studies and they
implemented the use of a cover letter when home studies are sent to applicants to
verify that the report and recommendation were provided to the applicant.
Interviews – It was reported to me that the agency staff have been able to maintain
consistent contact with supervision during recent changes to include remote work
and that while remote work has presented challenges, staff have been able to
maintain compliance.
VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
